[libcxx] fix mi_mode_test failure with libc++-21

medium

This pull request addresses a failure in the `mi_mode_test` test when using libc++ version 21. The issue arises because the test now compares sorted lists, which breaks due to changes in libc++-21.

  • Fixes a test failure in mi_mode_test
  • Affects comparison of JSON-serialized objects produced by GDB pretty printers
  • Issue present only with libcxx-21, not with earlier versions like libcxx-20

[flang] do concurrent: fix reduction symbol resolution when mapping to OpenMP

medium

This PR addresses a bug in the flang compiler where reduction operations did not properly resolve symbols when being mapped to OpenMP. The solution involves using module passes to ensure that the same reduction operation can be reused across multiple functions if they use the same reduction type.

  • Fixes a bug in symbol resolution for reductions
  • Uses module passes for better reusability of reduction operations
  • Affects the OpenMP pass within flang's optimizer
CompilerflangOpenMPReduction operationsSymbol resolutionlowLLVMBackend/TargetIR/Pass

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/155355

[clang] Add the candiscard attribute to suppress nodiscard

medium

This PR adds support for the `canddiscard` attribute in Clang, allowing functions marked with this attribute to disable the `[[nodiscard]]` attribute. This resolves a requirement that was stated in llvm#139651 and will allow continued work on fixing llvm#130656.

  • Add support for the `canddiscard` attribute
  • Allows disabling of `[[nodiscard]]` at function level
  • Resolves requirement mentioned in llvm#139651

Fix Test Added to Account for Windows Style Path Separators

medium

A recent pull request (#155354) aimed at fixing a test that was failing on Windows build bots. The issue seemed to stem from an oversight in handling Windows style path separators, which are different from Unix/Linux style paths (use of backslashes instead of forward slashes). This summary aims to provide a quick reference for understanding the context and importance of this change.

  • Fixing test failures on Windows build bots
  • Added support for Windows style path separators in tests
  • Resolution based on feedback from previous related fixes (PR #155303)
CompilerWindows BuildCI FixSecurity MitigationlowLLVM

Add C++23 stacktrace (P0881R7)

medium

A new feature request for adding support in C++23's stack trace, specifically allowing the invocation of tools like `addr2line`, `llvm-addr2line` or `atos`. This PR is part of a larger effort to improve and expand existing compiler functionalities.

  • Add support for C++23's stacktrace feature
  • Allowing tools like addr2line, llvm-addr2line, or atos in runtime context for debugging purposes
  • Updated in libcxx/CMakeLists.txt with a new option LIBCPP_STACKTRACE_ALLOW_TOOLS_AT_RUNTIME

AMDGPU: Handle rewriting VGPR MFMA fed from AGPR copy

medium

An ongoing development in the LLVM project aimed at improving the handling of Memory Fusion and Alignment (MFMA) operations for AMDGPU architectures. This includes a change to support cases where Virtual General-Purpose Registers (VGPRs) are used as sources or destinations, allowing them to be fed into an Auxiliary General Purpose Register (AGPR).

  • Improving the handling of MFMA operations in AMDGPU architecture.
  • Support for VGPR-to-AGPR and AGPR-to-VGPR copy cases.
  • Handling of phi nodes introduced a new complexity to consider.
AMDGPUMFMAVGPRAGPRReleaseLLVMBackend/Targetlow

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/153022

Add multi-way splitting support for wide scalar shifts in GlobalISel

medium

This PR aims to improve the optimization process by adding direct N-way splitting for wide scalar shifts instead of recursive binary splitting. The main motivation is to address compile time issues caused by the recursion and artifact combiner, which can result in very long compilation times.

  • Implement direct multi-way splitting for wide scalar shifts
  • Avoid recursive binary splitting for i4224 type issues
  • Reduce intermediate artifacts generation during compilation
CompilerIntelligenceOptimizationPerformancelowLLVMBackend/Target

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/155353

[RISCV][TTI] Implement getAddressComputationCost() in RISCV TTI

medium

The changes have led to some loops not being vectorized, but this is acceptable as they will use a similar access pattern to gather/scatter.

  • Add address computation cost function
  • Preparing for strided memory access optimization in Loop Vectorizer
  • Potential impact on loop vectorization

medium

This PR aims to optimize wave-scheduling in AMDGPU by ensuring that the 'waves-per-eu' attribute is updated only if it differs from what's calculated based on a flat workgroup size. This prevents unnecessary updates and aligns better with backend logic.

  • Aims to improve wave-scheduling efficiency in AMDGPU

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/155170

Compiler-Intel Update

medium

This cluster contains updates and new issues related to the LLVM project, including changes in pointer handling, coroutine-related bug fixing, HLSL optimizations, SPIR-V handling, and variadic macro support.

  • Pointer optimization: Simplify accessing members of an anonymous union directly
  • New request for commit access: Requested by a contributor focused on coroutine-related issues
  • HLSL vector<->array conversions as inout parameters with explicit casting restrictions
  • CIndex.cpp Dl_info usage without HAVE_DLFCN_H guard, leading to undefined behavior
  • Implement overloads of Load(int, out uint) for buffer types in HLSL
  • Remove unused uniformity bit from llvm.dx.resource.handlefrombinding function
  • Add __VA_COUNT__ macro support: Count number of variadic arguments

medium

This cluster contains updates and new issues related to the LLVM project, including changes in pointer handling, coroutine-related bug fixing, HLSL optimizations, SPIR-V handling, and variadic macro support.

  • Pointer optimization: Simplify accessing members of an anonymous union directly
  • New request for commit access: Requested by a contributor focused on coroutine-related issues
  • HLSL vector<->array conversions as inout parameters with explicit casting restrictions
  • CIndex.cpp Dl_info usage without HAVE_DLFCN_H guard, leading to undefined behavior
  • Implement overloads of Load(int, out uint) for buffer types in HLSL
  • Remove unused uniformity bit from llvm.dx.resource.handlefrombinding function

high

A pull request that refactors the RISCV vector built-in code generation to improve compilation times and enhance code organization. high

The LLDB debugger's Breakpoint functionality does not work correctly when enabling Machine Function Splitting (MFS). This issue arises because the cold code part of a function is split off into a different 'function', leading to incorrect backtraces or absence of frames in the debugging process.

  • Breakpoints and crash points do not work as expected with MFS enabled
  • Cold parts of functions are incorrectly treated as separate entries, causing issues with debug information

Nonsensical Warning for Out-of-Bounds Access to Vector Type

high

A warning issued by Clang for an out-of-bounds access in a vector type function is described. The warning incorrectly suggests that accessing the array index 2305843009213693951 would refer past the last possible element, given the size of 64-bit elements (8 bytes) and known statically limit of 2 elements for an 8-byte array. This warning is misleading as smaller indices do not trigger a warning.

  • Nonsensical Clang warning for out-of-bounds access
  • Incorrect array index calculation leading to false positive
  • Function uses vector_size attribute with size 8 (64-bit elements)
  • Static limit of 2 elements for an array of 8-byte elements

Two commits were made to enhance the resilience of test case updates in the LLVM project. The first commit addressed making pass-test-update.py more resilient (NFC), while the second commit ensured that only failing tests run the --update-tests functions.

  • Resilience improvement for pass-test-update.py
  • Ensuring --update-tests function runs on failing tests only

RFC: Introducing memref aliasing attributes

medium

Discussed on LLVM's Discourse forum, proposing to add aliasing metadata to the memref dialect for fine-grained control over memory read/write operations and optimizations.

  • Proposed introduction of aliasing metadata similar to LLVM's existing system in the memref dialect
  • Example code showing how memref load/store operations can have aliasing attributes attached, including a domain scope and lists of alias scopes and noalias operations
RFCmemrefaliasingoptimizationlowBackend/TargetIR/PassLLVM

medium

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/155299

  • Inconsistency in behaviour between codegen in DXILRootSignature and yaml2obj regarding StaticSamplersOffset.
  • The static sampler offset is computed differently by DXC (outputting to the first static sampler) and yaml2obj (ignoring given value if no samplers are present).
  • Proposal to either remove these parameters from manual specification or make them optional.

Compiler-Intel Issues and Fixes

high

Two issues have been reported with the LLVM compiler, specifically related to vector intrinsics in Intel's compiler. The first issue involves incorrect handling of `-O2` optimization flags with specific vector intrinsics on x86_64-linux-gnu systems. The second issue pertains to an incorrect behavior when using `-Os` optimization flag combined with specific vector intrinsics.

  • - Incorrect handling of `-O2` optimizations with `-mllvm -force-vector-width=1 -mllvm -force-vector-interleave=2` on x86_64-linux-gnu
  • - Incorrect behavior when using `-Os` optimization flag with `-mllvm -force-vector-width=4 -mllvm -force-vector-interleave=2` on x86_64-linux-gnu
Compiler-Intel IssuesOptimization BugsVector IntrinsicsLinuxCVE (pending)Backend/TargetlowLLVM

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/154967https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/155162https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/153946

DirectX backend clean up to_underlying

medium

A bunch of switch statements in the DirectX backend have been written with llvm::to_underlying as case labels, which operate on enums but use integers. The team proposes rewriting these switches to convert integers to enum values and having them operate directly on those values.

  • Switch statements using llvm::to_underlying should be rewritten to handle integers correctly
  • Rewriting the code will ensure all cases are covered without compiler warnings
DirectXCompilerSwitch statement cleanuplowLLVMBackend/Target

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/150676

HLSL: Add Support for Loop Metadata Kinds

medium

GitHub issue [LLVM/llvm-project#137387] discussing adding support for loop metadata kinds in HLSL compilation, specifically llvm.loop.unroll.full, llvm.loop.unroll.disable, and llvm.loop.unroll.count.

  • Need to whitelist certain loop metadata nodes (llvm.loop.unroll.full, llvm.loop.unroll.disable, and llvm.loop.unroll.count) that DXC validator accepts.
  • Add validation for new loop metadata node kinds in the same way as the existing dxc validator does.
  • Ensure recursive validation for unroll count metadata kind; if operand number is not 1 or 2, emit a validation error.
Compiler-IntelHLSLLoop MetadataValidationlowLLVM

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/137387

Error Encountered During Rust Compilation Using LLD on Aarch64

high

An error occurs when attempting to compile rust with LLVM's linker lld version 20.1.8 on aarch64 architecture, specifically due to the '--fix-cortex-a53-835769' argument being unrecognized.

  • Error encountered during compilation of Rust code using LLD
  • Specific error message: 'unknown argument --fix-cortex-a53-835769'
  • Problem arises due to the inclusion of '--fix-cortex-a53-835769' flag at an unexpected stage in the build process
  • No straightforward way to override or disable this specific LLD option
rust-compilerLLVM-lldaarch64RustLLVMToolchainlow

Headers[X86] VectorExprEvaluator::VisitCallExpr - Allow AVX2/AVX512 per-element shift intrinsics

medium

The issue describes a feature request for handling vector shift intrinsics inside the VectorExprEvaluator::VisitCallExpr, specifically focusing on 128/256/512 variants of _mm*_sllv_epi16, _mm*_srlv_epi16, and similar intrinsics. The intrinsics are used to perform elementwise shift operations in AVX2/AVX512.

  • Add constexpr test coverage for vector shift intrinsics
  • Handle special cases for out-of-bounds shifts and logical/arithmetic shifts
  • Clamp the shift amount for arithmetic shifts to (bitwidth-1) splatting the sign bit
AVX2AVX512VectorShiftIntrinsicsconstexprlowLLVM

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/154287

medium

A discussion about best practices in propagating discardable attributes through OneShotBufferization in LLVM.

  • Need for a clean way to propagate discardable attributes through OneShotBufferization
  • Specifically, the issue of keeping an attribute on tensor.insert_slice op and ensuring it is also present on the memref.copy op after bufferization

Gadget scanner vulnerability in BRK instruction

high

A commit has been made to the LLVM/LLVM-project repository, introducing a change where the BRK instruction is now used to indicate vulnerabilities. This change affects multiple functions related to authentication oracles.

  • BRK instruction introduced as indicator of vulnerability in the context of authentication and oracle checks
  • The commit modifies existing functions resign_xpac* to use BRK for indicating potential security issues
  • Changes affect several function patterns including different registers, conditions, and incorrect pattern references
securityCVELLVMlow

  • Support added for Fortran language
  • Compatibility maintained with existing OpenMP constructs

low

Add SCF-to-Affine Conversion Pass in MLIR

medium

This RFC proposes the addition of a new pass within the MLIR framework, specifically designed to convert Scalar Construction Framework (SCF) loops into Affine dialect loops. The motivation behind this is to enable better analysis and polyhedral-style optimizations available within the Affine dialect.

  • The SCF-to-Affine conversion pass aims to enhance optimization opportunities by promoting analyzable SCF loops to the more advanced Affine dialect.
  • This transformation will allow MLIR itself, not just specific projects like Polygeist, to provide better optimizations at the core level.
  • The proposed change is inspired by previous work in the Polygeist project and seeks to standardize this functionality within the MLIR framework for wider reuse.
MLIRSCF-to-Affine ConversionPolygeist InspirationlowIR/PassLLVM

https://discourse.llvm.org/t/rfc-add-scf-to-affine-conversion-pass-in-mlir/88036

Re: [PATCH v2] [x86] Enable unroll in the vectorizer when there's reduction for FMA/DOT_PROD_EXPR/SAD_EXPR

[PATCH v2] Fix sanitizer attribute infrastructure to use standard TREE_LIST format [PR113264]

low

Add test case for PR tree-optimization/121656

medium

A patch has been submitted to add a new test case in the GCC test suite for the PR tree-optimization/121656 issue. The test case is intended to verify if the compiler optimizes certain code as expected under optimization level -O1.

  • New file added: gcc/testsuite/gcc.dg/pr121656.c
  • Testcase requires support for weak attribute or noipa in GCC
  • Signed-off-by provided by H.J. Lu
GCCPR tree-optimization/121656testcaselowToolchainIR/Pass

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CA+=Sn1nEirbWw1X3z2guzYyoyrdNJtu9E4OS8OAFc01seEX97w@mail.gmail.com/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/875xear8ji.fsf@gentoo.org/

Add test case for PR tree-optimization/121656

medium

GCC i386: Fix Up Recent Changes to Use GFNI for Rotates/Shifts

medium

This commit modifies the GCC compiler's handling of rotates and shifts, specifically targeting the ix86 architecture. The changes aim to utilize GFNI instructions (General-Fused Multiply-Add Instruction) for improved performance in some operations.

  • Use of GFNI instructions for rotate/shift operations on i386 architecture
  • Update ix86_vgf2p8affine_shift_matrix function call
  • Modifications to ix86_expand_vecop_qihi based on architectural changes
GCCi386GFNIrotate/shiftperformance improvementBackend/Targetlow

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/d551f88f88b821dc80de9d39c5b275a3678b3e31

ARC Builtins Const Attribute Support

medium

A patch proposal for GCC's ARC target to mark mathematical ARC builtins as const to enable compiler optimizations like common subexpression elimination.

  • Add const attribute support for mathematical ARC builtins: __builtin_arc_ffs, __builtin_arc_fls, __builtin_arc_norm, __builtin_arc_normw, and __builtin_arc_swap.
  • The changes are part of the ARC target-specific infrastructure in GCC's config/arc/builtins.def file.
  • Marking these builtins as const is expected to allow compiler optimizations like common subexpression elimination.
GCCARC targetconst attributecompiler optimizationReleaseBackend/TargetIR/PasslowToolchain

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250826042212.work.202-kees@kernel.org/

Fix an ICE with recent GFNI changes

medium

A patch has been submitted to fix an internal compiler error (ICE) related to GFNI instructions. The fix involves modifying the expand pattern for operand 1 in rotate patterns.

  • Use register_operand for operand 1 in rotate patterns.
  • Create a new test case `gcc.target/i386/pr121658.c`.
  • The patch addresses PR 121658 and is included in the GCC ChangeLog.
  • Changes are made to gcc/config/i386/sse.md.
  • New files were created: `gcc/testsuite/gc.../pr121658.c`.
GCCICE FixGFNI InstructionsToolchainIR/PasslowBackend/Target

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/CAMZc-by0aosrXcshT4N8yP1gW1KBwxt2AvNZThyZFUdsVgsSnQ@mail.gmail.com/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/20250826013756.2735739-1-ak@linux.intel.com/

[flang] Register and lower SECNDS (stubbed implementation)

medium

This patch registers and lowers the GNU extension intrinsic `SECNDS` in Flang. Registration and lowering are wired through the intrinsic infrastructure. The genSecnds() function currently emits a TODO fatal error, marking it as unimplemented.

  • Registers and lowers the GNU extension intrinsic `SECNDS`
  • Emits a TODO fatal error for the `genSecnds()` function to mark it as unimplemented
flangSECNDSintrinsicstubbed implementationlowGCCLLVM

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/commit/86bca2963f9c03c9156cf0696bc792002e99709ehttps://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/b11ee352ca75fb33c1679d07f706b98fa6bb9ce4

OpenMP: Fix handling of 'simd' selector on 'declare variant'

medium

A patch series submitted for the GCC project to address incomplete implementation of the 'simd' selector on the 'declare variant' feature in OpenMP. The current patches handle this by emitting a 'sorry' message for unimplemented functionality.

  • Incomplete 'simd' selector handling implemented as a 'sorry' message
  • Needs specification of implementation-defined functionality for documentation
GCCOpenMPSecuritylowBackend/TargetIR/Pass

GCC RISC-V Vector and OMP Improvements

medium

This commit series includes several updates to the GCC compiler, focusing on improvements for the RISC-V architecture in terms of vector instructions and optimizations for OpenMP.

  • Add new patterns to generate vmacc RTL for the RISC-V vector architecture.
  • Enhance autovec-opt.md with a new pattern for matching vmacc vx combine.
  • Modify expand_omp_for_init_counts function in omp-expand.cc to clear loop.n2 before first zero count check if needed.
  • Update dwarf2ctf.cc to use unsigned HWI for array_num_elements and fallback to CTF_K_UNKNOWN if the type has too many elements.

RISC-V: Add Tests for Autovec Features

medium

Two commits were made to the GCC repository, both related to adding tests for autovec features in RISC-V. The commits describe changes to test files that include macros and function calls like TEST_BINARY_VX_SIGNED_0, TEST_TERNARY_VX_SIGNED_0, TEST_BINARY_VX_UNSIGNED_0, and TEST_TERNARY_VX_UNSIGNED_0. These functions are designed to test the autovec (automatic vectorization) features in RISC-V.

  • Add tests for autovec features in RISC-V
  • Include macros like TEST_BINARY_VX_SIGNED_0 and TEST_TERNARY_VX_UNSIGNED_0
  • Function calls to specific functions like vadd.vx, vsaddu.vx, and vmacc.vx

GCC i386: Fixing Recent Changes to Use GFNI for Rotates/Shifts [PR121658]

medium

This patch addresses issues introduced in recent GCC changes, specifically related to using the Generic Fixed-Point Number Interface (GFNI) for rotating and shifting operations. The patch fixes bugs where incorrect predicates were used for operands passed to patterns like vgf2p8affineqb_ and v16qi3.

  • Fixes issues with the use of 'register_operand' and 'general_operand' in specific GCC patterns
  • Uses 'force_reg' instead of 'nonimmediate_operand' for certain cases where MEM operands are involved
  • Changes from using 'GEN_INT (0)' to 'const0_rtx' for formatting improvements
GCCi386GFNICompiler InternalslowBackend/Target

Initialize fd->loop.n2 if needed for the zero iter case

medium

This patch addresses a bug in the GCC compiler's OpenMP (Open Multi-Processing) implementation. The issue arises when initializing `fd->loop.n2`, which is used to track the number of iterations in an OpenMP loop. If `zero_iter1_bb` is non-null, it ensures that this variable is cleared before checking for zero iterations.

  • Ensure fd->loop.n2 is initialized before checking for zero iterations
  • Handle edge cases where zero_iter1_bb is non-null
  • Clear the var if needed and not already set earlier
OpenMPGCCCompiler FixlowIR/Pass

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/aKzk6NLyMYBJ5ghD@tucnak/https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/948f20cc520e50968f8759b173096358dcbba3de

medium

A patch to fix the handling of sanitizer attributes in GCC, specifically fixing an internal compiler error related to copying these attributes.

  • Fixing the handling of sanitizer attributes by wrapping INTEGER_CST values in TREE_LIST structures.
  • Eliminates crashes when copying sanitizer attributes due to their violation of standard GCC attribute infrastructure.
  • The patch is aimed at maintaining compatibility and preventing internal compiler errors.

GCC CTF Array and Type Size Enhancements

low

Two patches were submitted to address issues with CTF array and type size handling in GCC's DWARF encoding. The first patch fixes a potential overflow issue for the number of elements in arrays, while the second addresses a similar problem but for type bit sizes. Both fixes use unsigned HOST_WIDE_INT instead of uint32_t to avoid truncation errors.

  • Fixes array element count overflow
  • Adapts DWARF type size handling
  • Uses unsigned HOST_WIDE_INT to prevent overflows

OpenMP: Fix handling of 'simd' selector on 'declare variant'

medium

This thread discusses a patch to fix how OpenMP handles the 'simd' selector in relation to 'declare variant'. The discussion revolves around how name lookup is performed and where the generation of call expressions should occur relative to vectorization.

  • The current approach for substitution of variants happens during gimplification, which is before any vectorization.
  • There are concerns about moving the generation of call expression from declare variant declaration side due to different requirements based on OpenMP specification and design decisions.
  • OpenMP specifies that the function variant should be determined by the base language standard name lookup rules using argument types at the call site, contrary to how it is currently implemented.
OpenMPGCCCompiler ChangesVariant Handlinglow

https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/aKyf7Sagl6CyTGsL@tucnak/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/aKySn809G9fT6UxK@tucnak/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/c31c236f-3060-4ff6-8023-254aab2d7234@baylibre.com/https://inbox.sourceware.org/gcc-patches/aKyDtRBLeg6qeafo@tucnak/

Boolify simplify_permutation function in GCC

medium

The commit updates the simplify_permutation function to return a boolean value instead of an integer, indicating changes made in simplifying permutations. The change was part of the Boolify project aiming to improve code readability and maintainability.

  • Function signature changed from returning int to bool
  • Introduced new functions like maybe_identity1 and maybe_identity2 for handling conditional logic

GCC Remove Return Type of remove_prop_source_from_use

low

  • Remove return type from function `remove_prop_source_from_use`
  • Function now returns void instead of bool
GCCCompilerC++Removal of return typeSSA namesIR/PassmediumRelease

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/dbed17b1ee2e1c119eb21b9a5fefce582675a9e3

Rewrite bool loads for undefined case

high

A commit in the GCC repository addressed issues related to boolean loads not properly handling their precision when used as loads.

  • Boolean loads need special handling due to their non-masking issue with precision.
  • Only non-mode-precision booleans require a rewrite, and bit-field references are excluded from this rule.
  • The commit ensures that integral types converted to smaller precisions through VCE (Value Conversion Expression) will be correctly casted.
gccCVEsecuritybehavior breakinglowGCCIR/Pass

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/7269aa0765415df071778b92bd9ecea82f8ea5b2

GCC C++ CWG3048 - Empty destructuring expansion statements

high

The commit message describes a change in the GCC compiler to handle empty destructuring expansions more gracefully. The change involves handling cases where an expansion statement has no elements, previously leading to warnings or errors.

  • Handle empty destructuring expansions more gracefully in C++
  • Previously only warned about or errored for empty destructuring expansions
  • Now checks if the size of the expansion is zero and handles it appropriately
GCCC++CVESecuritylow

https://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/commit/05baaa6feb9a8093646113c95f4cb8590ddd6de8

GCC cxx_bind_parameters_in_call Check for *jump_target Early

medium

A commit in the GCC repository addresses a test case that ICEs due to undefined behavior caused by calling non-static member functions with NULL argument.

  • *jump_target* check moved earlier in the code
  • Addresses undefined behavior related to lambda function pointer conversion operator thunks
  • Fixes issues where *integer_zerop* on NULL_TREE can cause ICEs

  • Uses '-fgimple -fno-tree-scev-cprop' compiler flags

vec_packs Optimization Issue on s390x

medium

The issue involves a manual vector packing function (`narrow_manual`) defined for the s390x architecture. The function uses bitwise operations to pack smaller integer vectors into larger ones, but it is not being optimized as expected using `vec_packs`.

  • Manual vector packing (`narrow_manual`) does not optimize well on s390x
  • Works correctly and optimizes for x86_64 and aarch64 architectures
  • Not optimized to `vec_packs`, resulting in lower performance compared to other architectures
Compiler Optimizations390x Architecturevec_packsPerformance IssueCranelift/WasmtimelowLLVMWASM

https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/153655

  • Online sync-ups will focus on ClangIR upstreaming, pointer authentication, OpenMP, Flang, RISC-V, LLVM libc, and HLSL topics

Swift

EXC_BAD_ACCESS Caused by Inherited std.vector Field Access

high

A minimal test case shows that in C++ and Swift integration, accessing an inherited `std::vector` of `std::string` fields causes EXC_BAD_ACCESS. This issue is related to a reported bug where calling methods on a child object’s vector results in premature freeing.

  • EXC_BAD_ACCESS error occurs when accessing an inherited std.vector field
  • Issue may be connected with a known Swift language issue involving std.strings and base classes
  • Minimal test case provided to reproduce the error
  • Workaround involves passing object to a C++ function returning vector
EXC_BAD_ACCESSSwift-CPP integrationstd.vectorstd.stringlowBackend/TargetIR/PassSwift

https://forums.swift.org/t/accessing-inherited-std-vector-std-string-field-causes-exc-bad-access/81807

  • No such file or directory error occurs
  • GitShellError: result: also appears occasionally
